headline.main: BERLIN HINTS JAPAN WILL STRIKE RUSSIA; Stockholm Hears Authorized Circles Tale of 'Slightly Increased Tension' NO BIG RISKS ENVISAGED Spokesmen Said to Assert That Soviet Has Reduced Forces in Far East

lead_paragraph: STOCKHOLM, Sweden, March 31 -- Rumors of a forthcoming Japanese attack on Russia persistently circulate in Berlin, the correspondent of the Social Demokraten reports tonight.
abstract: Stockholm Social Demokraten repts Berlin rumors of Jap attack on USSR
snippet: STOCKHOLM, Sweden, March 31 -- Rumors of a forthcoming Japanese attack on Russia persistently circulate in Berlin, the correspondent of the Social Demokraten reports tonight....

byline.original: By Telephone to THE NEW YORK TIMES
